channel.title: Protobuf Team Design Decisions on Protocol Buffers Documentation
channel.description: Recent content in Protobuf Team Design Decisions on Protocol Buffers Documentation

item.title: No Nullable Setters/Getters Support
item.description: We have heard feedback that some folks would like protobuf to support nullable getters/setters in their null-friendly language of choice (particularly Kotlin, C#, and Rust). While this does seem to be a helpful feature for folks using those languages, the design choice has tradeoffs which have led to the Protobuf team choosing not to implement them. The biggest reason not to have nullable fields is the intended behavior of default values specified in a .
